pullRequest.title: gRPC client config support
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adds a new optional top-level server.xml element <grpcTarget/>, which can be used to set properties for gRPC services managed via grpcClient-1.0.  A single grpcTarget configuration can apply to one or many services.  Currently the following properties can be set:

target = required string

outbound host for which to apply this config
examples: “localhost”, “grpc.io”, "*"


authnToken = optional string

specify desired auth to apply: options are one of ltpa, saml, jwt, oauth, or mpjwt
beta support limited to jwt and oauth


headersToPropagate = optional string

specify a list of header names that Liberty should attempt to propagate


enableKeepAlive = optional boolean
keepAliveTime = optional int
keepAliveTimeout = optional int
maxInboundMessageSize = optional int
clientInterceptors = optional string {list of fully qualified class names}

specify interceptors that will be applied to this service
this list is merged with the annotation-defined list at runtime


sslConfig = optional string

the ID of the SSL configuration to use



Example:
<grpcTarget target="*" authnToken="jwt" headersToPropagate="authorization" maxInboundMessageSize="100" enableKeepAlive="true" clientInterceptors="com.ibm.ws.grpc.HelloWorldClientInterceptor"/>
For #10089 and #10090

nodes.bodyText: Does "when they are constructed" refer to the time that the configuration properties are applied or the time that gRPC targets  match the specified URI?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+###############################################################################

+# -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+#CMVCPATHNAME com.ibm.ws.grpc.client/resources/OSGI-INF/l10n/metatype.properties
+#ISMESSAGEFILE FALSE
+#NLS_ENCODING=UNICODE
+#NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE
+
+
+clientConfig=GRPC Client Properties
+clientConfig.desc=Configuration properties to be applied to gRPC targets that match the specified URI when they are constructed

nodes.bodyText:
are quotes necessary?
Currently supported types are jwt or oauth

+
+target=Remote target
+target.desc=The remote gRPC target URI, with wildcard support.
+
+headersToPropagate=HTTP header names to propagate
+headersToPropagate.desc=HTTP header names to propagate from an inbound request to an outbound call.
+
+clientInterceptors=GRPC client Interceptors
+clientInterceptors.desc=A list of fully qualified class names for gRPC client interceptor classes.
+
+authnToken=Authorization token
+authnToken.desc=The type of authorization token to propagate.  Currently this must be "jwt" or "oauth".

nodes.bodyText:
this is news to me but IBM terminology specifies keepalive, one word. Here's the guidance-
keepalive
adjective
Pertaining to the amount of time that elapses before a message is sent to verify a connection.
noun
A TCP/IP mechanism where a small packet is sent across the network at predefined intervals to determine whether the socket is still working correctly.
If this description applies to the function, update all instances to a single-word term

nodes.bodyText:
An id of an ssl reference found in server.xml. The ssl configuration that is specified by that reference is used.
Single space between these sentences.
